text: [Music]
credit card debt has just become a way
of life in our country in fact credit
cards weren't even available about 30
years ago and um you're right you know
we we use it as a way to extend our
income so when I talk to families and to
Consumers at large I'm a big believer
that we have to teach our young kids you
know as teenagers how to use credit
cards wisely in other words paying it
off on a monthly basis understanding how
fees and interest work a lot of people
were not educated about this and what
we're finding through our studies is
that teenagers you know 13 to 18 years
old already owe on average $300 to an
individual or an institution so even our
young you know kids are are using these
credit cards and so um parents really
need to to work with them and make it a
discipline to pay it off monthly and and
similar to like to teaching your kid how
to to drive you want them to do it under
your roof before they leave home and can
get in a lot of trouble
[Music]
